intro: Arthrosamanea pullei, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its latex sap is milky and has been used traditionally for various purposes. Arthrosamanea pullei is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique appearance and adaptability to different soil types.
